DOCNAME: CASE OF KAMILOVA v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE , the applicant brought a civil action against Mr NORP ( “ the debtor ” ) claiming restoration of the outstanding debt related to a loan that she had given to him in DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE they reached a court settlement ( судско порамнување , “ the court settlement ” ) under which the debtor was required to pay the outstanding debt in equal DATE instalments .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the first- instance court ” ) granted the applicant 's request of DATE ordering enforcement of the court settlement , less DM CARDINAL which the debtor had meanwhile paid . The applicant proposed an inventory , valuation and public sale of movable and immovable property of the debtor . On CARDINAL DATE she further specified her request as concerning a house and plot of land ( “ the property ” ) . In this connection , she submitted an extract from the land registry ( “ the registry ” ) dated DATE attesting the debtor 's title to the property . She also requested the first - instance court to record a charging order over the property ( да стави прибелешка врз имотот на должникот ) so as to secure her claim .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court ordered valuation of the property . It was carried out on DATE . The first - instance court 's decision in this respect dated DATE . It was served on the debtor on DATE .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , the first - instance court ordered CARDINAL adjournments because of the debtor 's absence .

CARDINAL . By submissions of DATE and DATE respectively , the applicant informed the first - instance court that the debtor had transferred the property to his father 's possession on the basis of a court decision of DATE . She requested the first - instance court to continue with the enforcement since the debtor had regained possession of the property after his father died .
CARDINAL . No further actions were taken for enforcement of the applicant 's claim .
CARDINAL . LAW ( “ LAW ” ) of DATE ( ORG за извршување ) provides that bailiffs ( извршители ) carry out the enforcement .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the LAW provides that the enforcement proceedings instituted before the LAW entered into force are to continue , until DATE , under LAW of DATE . Thereafter , the DATE Act applies .
